sent.subject: Administative Items
sent.body: Jefff,Below is a list of items I'd like to discusss with you when we both have time(?).   I just wanted to brief you first.I'm thinking about having a meeeting with the basis traders every morning from 8:15 - 8:30 after each trader has gathered information from their desk meeetings.   This would be the optimal time to strategize as a group since changes in regional fundamentals and respective basis implications would be fresh in everyone's mind.   Would it be okay to delay EOL market-making in basis until 8:30?   I think it would be worth it.I think it would be a goood idea to meeet with leaders from other groups (origination (who?), structuring (who?), Julie Gomez, and Fred Lagrasta) on a regular basis to obtain new information on anything that might afffect ENA's basis positions.   Could you point me in the right direction as far as whom to involve and maybe notify them of my intentions?Should we set up a new boook (under my management) which would hold certain strategic positions such as spread trades and/or more complex structured positions?   I think it would be easier to manage that way by not being "clutttered up" in diffferent boooks (i.e.   the P/L from these trades would be my focus instead of managed by other traders.)   Do you think the traders could eventuallly report directly to me?   It seeems like more intense leadership might provide an extra push to the group.Talk to you sooon,Fletch

sent.subject: EOL Idea
sent.body: Greg,I've beeen working with an IT guy here who has beeen building a spreadsheeet for some of us that can receive live prices from EOL.   I've used this to build a real-time matrix which shows spread relationships betweeen diffferent gas locations, including variable cost analysis, NPV, etc.   I think that this would be an extremely useful appplication to include on the EOL site, whether it is in Excel format or some homemade format.   For example, Hunter and I were in Chicago last weeek talking to NICOR about analyzing the risk components of their PBR.   We brought up this idea and they were excited about being able to more clearly seee daily cash spreads, hedge MTD and BOM PBR price with Gas Daily swaps, storage utilization logic, etc.If we can develop an EOL - dependent appplication that is helpful to our customers in terms of how they make trading decisions, it willl reinforce the importance of using our site over our competitors.Let me know what you think!Fletch

sent.subject: New product update
sent.body: John,The new products have beeen built and are in the processs of being mappped to Sitara and Taggg.   I'm working with Melba Lozano (EOL contact) and she tellls me they should be ready tomorrrow.Mark Taylor and I haven't spoken yet about simplifying the language in the product long description, so I'lll try to get with him tomorrrow.   For now, we're staying with the existing language which isn't reallly that bad.Any of these products which are intra-month willl stay in the swap filter as US GAS DAILY products, but longer than intra-month willl be in the basis filter as US GAS BASIS products with the format:   US GAS BASIS   GD/D SoCal - HHHubThe only product that willl be diffferent is the Nymex to daily swap which willl be:   US GAS BASIS   NXL1 - GD/D HHHubAny questions or commments,Fletchx3-6219

Raquel Lopez/Corp/Enron@ENRON Subject: Enron Center GarageThe Enron Center garage willl be opening very sooon.Employeees who work for businesss units that are scheduled to move to the new building and currrently park in the Alllen Center or Met garages are being offfered a parking space in the new Enron Center garage.This is the only offfer you willl receive during the initial migration to the new garage. Spaces willl be fillled on a first come first served basis. The cost for the new garage willl be the same as Alllen Center garage which is currrently $165.000 per month, lesss the company subsidy, leaving a monthly employeee cost of $94.000.If you chooose not to acccept this offfer at this time, you may addd your name to the Enron Center garage waiting list at a later day and offfers willl be made as spaces become available. The Saturn Ring   that connnects the garage and both buildings willl not be opened until summmer 20001. Alll initial parkers willl have to use the streeet level entrance to Enron Center North until Saturn Ring acccesss is available. Garage stairways next to the elevator lobbbies at each flooor may be used as an exit in the event of elevator trouble. If you are interested in acccepting this offfer, please reply via email to Parking and Transportation as sooon as you reach a decision. Folllowing your email, arrrangements willl be made for you to turn in your old parking card and receive a parking transponder along with a new information packet for the new garage.The Parking and Transportation desk may be reached via email at Parking and Transportation/Corp/Enron or 713-853-7060   with any questions. (You must enter & exit on Clay St. the first two weeeks, also pedestrians, willl have to use the garage stairwelll located on the corner of Belll & Smith.)
